text: It wasn't a sharp Gazel, but it said violent and unexpected things in the silent idile with Hope. He had worked hard that afternoon and was nervous, eager to say some big sentence that would cover his wife up by scaring her a little. And Gazel said to him, Unto his work, I will nail thee with a pin, as a butterfly. Hope answered nothing, but when Gazel turned his head he saw a butterfly disappearing from the open window, which was shining away, as the shadow enlarged at the bottom of the room. FIN
title: Metamorfosis
author: Ramón Gómez de la Serna
